content.description:
Start out matched on a left-facing sloper, then move straight up near a tree growing against the rock. This has big hands, long reaches, small feet, and unique moves. I think people will like it if anybody decides to try it. I would say it is V4, but I want a second opinion. I am also claiming the FA, but Bob Horan or Luke Childers may have already snagged this one years ago.

An easier variation starts standing with left hand on the sloper and right on the crimp/edge. This takes away two of the best moves, though.
content.location: This problem is clearly visible from the road, about halfway between the parking lots. Park at the first parking lot, and take the ponderosa trail heading west. This boulder is right by a switchback in the trail, and the tree growing against the rock is its identifying feature.

content.description: This is on the right side of the boulder. Do a sit down start on jugs.
content.location:
This is along the Ponderosa Trail, closer to the first parking lot than

Treefort

. It is clearly visible from the road.

content.description: This is on the left side of the boulder. Start with your right hand on a jug and your left on a crimp.
content.location: Along the ponderosa trail, closer to the first parking lot than Treefort. Clearly visible from the road.

content.description: Start low on good holds below a horizontal crack. Surf to the right arete, and follow it to the top.
content.location: Uphill from the roadside boulders, locate a small headwall, and walk to the rightmost (east) end to find this boulder. This is on the north side of the boulder.

content.description: Gain a finger-stack pocket, and climb straight above on small crimps.
content.location: Uphill from the road side boulders is a small headwall with a few blocks. This block stands freely at the rightmost (east) end of the wall. The photo provided should help with a little searching.

content.description: Start low and right on huge holds. Traverse a bit left to the center of the boulder to a mantel, and climb straight up on jugs.
content.location: Uphill from the roadside boulders, find a small headwall, and walk to the rightmost (east) end to find this boulder. This problem is on the west face.
